tuv.seg: Voting procedure in a general election
Modh vótála in olltoghchán

The returning officer is the County Sheriff or the County Registrar for the county and is the person responsible for organising the poll, printing the ballot papers and counting the votes in each constituency

Is é Sirriam an Chontae, nó Cláraitheoir an Chontae an ceann comhairimh agus is é/í an duine atá freagrach as an vótáil a eagrú, na páipéir ballóide a phriontáil, agus na vótaí a chomhaireamh i ngach dáilcheantar
The returning officer provides polling stations - usually schools and public buildings are used
Cuireann an ceann comhairimh ionaid vótála ar fáil -de ghnáth baintear úsáid as scoileanna agus foirgnimh phoiblí
Each candidate at a general election may be represented by a "personation agent" at the polling station
D'fhéadfadh gach iarrthóir gníomhaire pearsanaíochta a bheith aige/aice ag an ionad vótála
The personation agent supervises the polling and helps prevent electoral offences
Déanann an gníomhaire pearsanaíochta maoirseacht ar an vótáil agus tugann sé/sí cúnamh chun coireanna vótála a sheachaint
If you are on the Register of Electors, a polling card will be sent to your home before the date of the general election
Má tá tú ar Chlár na Vótálaithe, seolfar carta vótála chuig do theach roimh dáta an olltoghcháin
Your polling card will include your elector number and will tell you where you can vote
Beidh d'uimhir vótála ar an gcárta vótála agus tabharfaidh sé eolas duit faoin ionad vótála
When you arrive at the polling station, you will be asked to state your name and address and you may be asked to prove your identity
Nuair a shroicheann tú an t-ionad vótála, iarrfar ort d'ainm agus do sheoladh a lua, agus d'fhéadfadh sé go n-iarrfaí ort cruthú cé thú féin
If you are asked to prove your identity and you cannot do so, you may not be allowed to vote
Má iarrtar ort cruthú cé thú féin agus má tharlaíonn sé nach bhfuil tú in ann é sin a dhéanamh, d'fhéadfadh sé nach dtabharfaí cead vótála duit
If the presiding officer is satisfied in relation to your identity, your ballot paper will be stamped and handed to you
Má tá an ceann comhairimh sásta maidir le d'aitheantas, stampáilfear do pháipéar ballóide agus tabharfar duit é
You will then go into a voting compartment
Ansin, rachaidh tú chuig bothán vótála
The names of the candidates in the election appear in alphabetical order on the ballot paper along with an indication of their political party, if any
Tugtar ainmneacha na n-iarrthóirí sa toghchán ar an bpáipéar ballóide in ord aibitre, le tagairt dá bpáirtí polaitíochta má tá baint acu le páirtí
A photograph of the candidate and/or a party emblem may also appear on the ballot paper
D'fhéadfadh griangraf iarrthóra agus/nó comhartha páirtí a bheith ar an bpáipéar ballóide freisin

You must indicate the order of your choice of candidates by writing 1 in the box beside the photograph of your first choice of candidate and, if you wish, write 2 beside the photograph of your second choice of candidate, 3 beside the photograph of your third choice and so on

Ní foláir duit ord do rogha a thaispeáint trí 1 a scríobh sa bhosca le hais griangraif an iarrthóra a roghnaíonn tú sa chéad áit, agus más mian leat, 2 le hais griangraf do dara rogha iarrthóra, 3 le hais do thriú rogha, agus mar sin de
When you vote this way, you are instructing the returning officer to transfer your vote to your second choice candidate if the first choice is either elected or eliminated
Nuair a vótáileann tú sa chaoi seo, tugann tú ordú don cheann comhairimh do vóta a aistriú chuig do dara rogha iarrthóra má tá do chéad rogha tofa nó díbeartha
If your second choice candidate is either elected or eliminated, your vote will be transferred to your third choice and so on
Má tá do dara rogha iarrthóra tofa nó díbeartha, aistreofar do vótá go dtí do thríú rogha agus mar sin de
This is known as a single transferable vote
Glaotar vóta amháin inaistrithe ar an gcóras seo
You must then fold your ballot paper to hide your vote and place it in the sealed ballot box
Ní foláir duit, ina dhiaidh sin, do phaipéar ballóide a fhilleadh chun do vóta a chur i bhfolach, agus é a chur sa bhosca ballóide séalta
You may only vote once at the election
Níl cead agat vótáil ach uair amháin sa toghchán
There are a number of procedures in place to allow people with disabilities to vote
Tá roinnt modhanna ar fáil chun deis a thabhairt do dhaoine faoi mhíchumas a vótaí a chaitheamh
Prisoners can vote by registering on the Postal Voters List
Is féidir le príosúnaigh vótáil trí chlárú ar an Liosta Postvótálaí
Eligibility to vote in a general election
Intofacht chun vótáil in Olltoghchán
In order to be able to vote in a general election:
Chun a bheith in ann vótáil in olltoghchán :
• You must be a citizen of Ireland or Britain
• Ní foláir duit a bheith i do shaoránach Éireannach nó Briotanach
• You must be 18 years of age on the day of the election
• Ní mór duit a bheith 18 mbliana d’aois ar lá an toghcháin
• Your name must be on the Register of Electors
• Caithfidh d'ainm a bheith ar Chlár na Vótálaithe
You must bring a valid form of personal identification, such as a:
Caithfidh tú foirm bhailí d'ábhar aitheantais pearsanta a thabhairt leat, mar shampla:
• Employee identity card containing a photograph
• Cárta aitheantais fostaithe le griangraf
• Student identity card issued by an educational institution and containing a photograph
• Cárta aitheantais do mhic léinn le griangraf eisithe ag institiúid oideachais
• Travel document containing name and photograph
• Cáipéis taistil le hainm agus griangraf
• Bank or Savings or Credit Union book containing your address in the constituency or electoral area
• Leabhar bainc, leabhar coigiltis, nó leabhar Comhar Creidmheasa le seoladh sa dáilcheantar nó sa cheantar toghchánach
• Cheque book and another document containing your address in the constituency
• Seicleabhar agus doiciméad eile a bhfuil do sheoladh sa cheantar ann
• Cheque card and another document containing your address in the constituency
• Seic-chárta agus doiciméad eile a bhfuil do sheoladh sa cheantar ann
• Credit card and another document containing your address in the constituency
• Cárta creidmheasaagus doiciméad eile a bhfuil do sheoladh sa cheantar ann
• Birth certificate and another document containing your address in the constituency
• Teastas breithe agus doiciméad eile a bhfuil do sheoladh sa cheantar ann
• Marriage certificate and another document containing your address in the constituency
• Teastas pósta agus doiciméad eile a bhfuil do sheoladh sa cheantar ann
The address of your local polling station will be given on your polling card, which will be posted out to you before the election is held
Beidh seoladh d'ionad vótála áitiúil ar do charta vótála, a seolfar chugat roimh an toghchán
